meanings.definition: To descend from the air and settle.
meanings.sent1: The bird will alight on the branch.
meanings.sent2: The butterfly will alight on the flower.
meanings.sent3: The feather floated gently down to alight on the ground.
meanings.sent4: Like a gentle breeze, she alighted gracefully on the stage.
meanings.sent5: The falling leaf seemed to alight in slow motion.

meanings.definition: To come down and settle, as after flight.
meanings.sent1: The airplane will alight on the runway.
meanings.sent2: The bee will alight on the colorful petals.
meanings.sent3: The paper airplane seemed to alight on the desk with a tiny bounce.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to alight in the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The snowflake will alight softly on the ground.

meanings.definition: To get down from a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: She will alight from the bus at the next stop.
meanings.sent2: The passengers will alight from the train at the station.
meanings.sent3: The toy car seemed to alight from the shelf and roll away.
meanings.sent4: His smile seemed to alight from his face, revealing his true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The child will alight from the swing and run to the playground.
